title: 110_hr392
content: The Act is titled the "District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act" and involves the issuance of redesigned quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and each of the territories. Section 5112 of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include a new subsection for the redesign and issuance of circulating quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and the territories in 2009. The designs on the reverse side of the coins will be emblematic of the District of Columbia and the territories, with flexibility in the placement of inscriptions. The Secretary may choose designs for quarter dollars issued in 2009 with specific inscriptions on the reverse and obverse sides. Each quarter dollar will feature a design emblematic of the District of Columbia or one of the territories. Six designs are required for the quarter dollars, each representing a different district or territory. The Secretary will select 6 designs for quarter dollars representing the District of Columbia and territories, in consultation with relevant officials and committees. The Secretary will select designs for quarter dollars representing the District of Columbia and territories in consultation with officials and committees. Designs must meet standards of dignity and pride, with participation from various individuals including District or territorial officials, artists, engravers, and the general public. The design selection process is at the sole discretion of the Secretary. The Secretary shall not choose frivolous or inappropriate designs for quarter dollars minted, and no head and shoulders portrait or bust of any person, living or dead, or portrait of a living person can be included. All coins minted will be considered numismatic items, and the Secretary may mint and issue quarter dollars in uncirculated and proof qualities. The Secretary may mint and issue quarter dollars in uncirculated and proof qualities, with some coins containing 90 percent silver. Coins honoring different territories will be issued in equal intervals during 2009. The Secretary will issue quarter dollars honoring different territories in equal intervals during 2009, including the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands. If a territory becomes a state or independent before its design is minted, the subsection will no longer apply. If a territory becomes independent or ceases to be a territory of the United States before quarter dollars with designs representing that territory are minted, this subsection will no longer apply to that territory. The term 'territory' refers to Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the US Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands. The House of Representatives passed the bill on January 23, 2007. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
